issues.title: Missing equation justification
issues.message: The derivation in Equation 3 skips several critical steps, making it impossible to verify the mathematical correctness.
issues.original_text: From Equation 2, we directly obtain Equation 3.
issues.proposed_rewrite: From Equation 2, applying the chain rule and substituting the boundary conditions (see Appendix A), we obtain Equation 3.
issues.rationale: Mathematical derivations must be complete enough for readers to verify. The jump from Eq. 2 to Eq. 3 is non-trivial.

issues.title: LaTeX formatting inconsistency
issues.message: Inconsistent use of \cite{} vs \citep{} commands throughout the manuscript.
issues.rationale: Consistent citation formatting improves readability. Choose either \cite or \citep and use throughout.

issues.title: Overfitting concerns not addressed
issues.message: The model has 15 free parameters but is validated on only 50 data points. High risk of overfitting.
issues.original_text: The model achieves R² = 0.98 on the validation set.
issues.proposed_rewrite: The model achieves R² = 0.98 on the validation set. To address overfitting concerns given the parameter-to-data ratio, we performed k-fold cross-validation (k=10) and bootstrapping analysis (n=1000).
issues.rationale: With 15 parameters and 50 data points, the high R² likely indicates overfitting rather than true predictive power.

issues.title: Undefined abbreviation
issues.message: The abbreviation 'DFT' is used without definition on first appearance.
issues.original_text: Calculations were performed using DFT with the B3LYP functional.
issues.proposed_rewrite: Calculations were performed using density functional theory (DFT) with the B3LYP functional.
issues.rationale: All abbreviations should be defined on first use, even common ones in the field.

issues.title: Figure reference formatting
issues.message: Inconsistent figure reference formatting (Figure vs Fig. vs figure).
issues.original_text: As shown in figure 2, the trend is clear (see also Figure 3 and Fig. 4).
issues.proposed_rewrite: As shown in Fig. 2, the trend is clear (see also Fig. 3 and Fig. 4).
issues.rationale: Use consistent formatting for all figure references throughout the manuscript.

rigor.label: Rigor Review
rigor.summary: The mathematical framework needs more rigorous justification, particularly in the derivations. Several technical issues should be addressed including undefined abbreviations and incomplete mathematical steps.

clarity.label: Clarity Review
clarity.summary: The manuscript has several formatting inconsistencies that detract from its professional presentation. LaTeX formatting and citation styles need standardization.

counterpoint.label: Counterpoint
counterpoint.summary: The statistical analysis appears questionable with clear signs of overfitting. The model complexity far exceeds what the data can support.
major_concerns: Severe overfitting risk with 15 parameters for 50 data points

metadata.notes: Full Review depth for LaTeX manuscript demo with mathematical and formatting issues
